title: What Has Happened To SKT?
body:
Last night I watched SKT T1 lose for the 4th time in a row. They didn't look good doing it either.

My thoughts head towards match fixing, seeing as gambling on matches has become available this season, but I hope not. The esports scene definitely doesn't need to have that stigma attached to it.

Maybe there is just discontent within the camp with the new roster!

What are other peoples thoughts on SKT T1's sudden downfall?

replies.body: Did they lose against Afreeca today? afreeca won the first and i stopped watching.

They're humans, playing other humans.

They aren't machines, it's not a numbers game _"SKT has a rating of 10... 10 is higher than 7, so 10 wins etc."_

Sure they might have a better score on paper, but we have all lost games against people we clearly were better than.

With any luck, they are getting old and their reactions are slowing, perhaps finally we can have new and interesting teams in the top spots.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=bbQ2LMmc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-20T22:26:36.946+0000)
>
> They're humans, playing other humans.
> 
> They aren't machines, it's not a numbers game _"SKT has a rating of 10... 10 is higher than 7, so 10 wins etc."_
> 
> Sure they might have a better score on paper, but we have all lost games against people we clearly were better than.
> 
> With any luck, they are getting old and their reactions are slowing, perhaps finally we can have new and interesting teams in the top spots.

They are making rookie errors that you wouldn't expect from a 1st class side, over extending into bad positioning, half the team going into a team fight while the other half bail out, stuff like that. Something is going on.
